image.alt: Welcoming orthodontic team in a bright clinic, Red Rock Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Welcome to Red Rock Orthodontics — where smiles are transformed into works of art. With locations in Spanish Fork and Payson, Utah, our practice blends cutting-edge orthodontic technology with personalized care to deliver healthy, beautiful smiles.

We take pride in using advanced 3D imaging and a full range of treatment options, from clear aligners and modern braces to surgical orthodontics, while delivering a patient-first experience that begins with your first phone call and continues long after treatment ends.

items.title: Advanced Technology

image.alt: Patient holding clear aligner tray, digital orthodontic care

items.text: We use 3D imaging, digital radiography, modern aligner workflows, Damon and ceramic braces, AcceleDent/Propel and TADs to streamline care and improve predictability.

items.title: Experienced Team

image.alt: Orthodontist portrait and professional care

items.text: Our board-level orthodontists deliver customized plans and expert care for children, teens and adults.

items.title: Patient‑first Philosophy

image.alt: Happy patients celebrating treatment milestones

items.text: Hire the best people, do our best work, be really kind and always stand by our work — your comfort and outcome matter to us.

items.title: Convenient Local Care

image.alt: Friendly orthodontic team at local office

items.text: Two Utah offices in Spanish Fork and Payson provide full-family orthodontics close to home.

paragraphs.text: Dr. Kimberly Doucette, Orthodontist. After dental school at Midwestern University and specialty training at the University of Nevada Las Vegas, where she earned a Certificate in Orthodontics and a Master of Science in Oral Biology, Dr. Doucette focuses on building strong patient relationships and delivering board-level care. She values compassion and personalized attention for every smile.

image.alt: Dr. Kimberly Doucette, Orthodontist at Red Rock Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Dr. Ryan Morris, Orthodontist. Dr. Morris completed his DDS and orthodontics training with honors and holds a Master of Science in Oral Sciences. A diplomate of the American Board of Orthodontics, he brings clinical research experience and a patient-centered approach to treatment, combining technical skill with thoughtful care.

image.alt: Dr. Ryan Morris, Orthodontist at Red Rock Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Dr. Adam Lee is a long-time practitioner associated with the team at Red Rock Orthodontics. He brings expertise in Invisalign clear aligners, Damon braces, AcceleDent and other modern techniques, and is dedicated to delivering individualized care and supporting the community through education and outreach.

image.alt: Dr. Adam Lee, orthodontist

paragraphs.text: From clear aligners to surgical orthodontics, we offer a full range of treatments to meet the needs of children, teens and adults.

image.alt: Patient holding clear aligner tray
Modern metal and ceramic braces
Orthognathic surgical coordination for jaw correction
Retention options including removable and bonded retainers
Parents with kids relaxing in front of home
Enjoying time together as a family

og_meta.title: Home - Red Rock Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Red Rock Orthodontics provides advanced orthodontic care in Spanish Fork and Payson, UT — clear aligners, braces, surgical orthodontics and retainers.

image.alt: Red Rock Orthodontics team smiling in the office

paragraphs.text: We are committed to providing an orthodontic experience that is second to none, from the first phone call to long after braces are removed. We hire the best people, do our best work, and always stand behind what we do.
Design the smile of your dreams: our experienced team blends clinical skill with an artistic eye to create individualized results that match your face and lifestyle.
We use the latest technology — Damon braces, Spark aligners, 3D cone beam imaging, digital radiography, AcceleDent and Propel — to make treatment more efficient, comfortable and predictable.
Above all, we strive to be kind and helpful at every step, offering flexible scheduling and supportive care so every patient leaves feeling confident about their smile.

image.alt: Dr. Kimberly Doucette

paragraphs.text: After graduating from dental school at Midwestern University in Glendale, Arizona, Dr. Kimberly Doucette continued her education with specialty training in orthodontics. She brings compassionate, patient-centered care to every treatment plan.
Dr. Doucette emphasizes building strong relationships with patients and tailoring treatment to each person's needs, blending clinical precision with an artistic approach to smiles.

image.alt: Dr. Kimberly Doucette smiling

paragraphs.text: Dr. Doucette earned her dental degree at Midwestern University and completed a Certificate in Orthodontics and a Master of Science in Oral Biology at the University of Nevada Las Vegas.

image.alt: Dr. Kimberly Doucette

paragraphs.text: Married to her high school sweetheart and a proud parent of three, Dr. Doucette enjoys family time, fitness and volleyball. She takes pride in guiding patients through every step of their orthodontic journey.

image.alt: Dr. Kimberly Doucette
Dr. Adam Lee

paragraphs.text: Dr. Adam Lee is recognized for his skill with modern orthodontic techniques and a strong record of community involvement. He guides the clinical team to provide care that combines efficiency with patient comfort.

image.alt: Dr. Adam Lee

paragraphs.text: Dr. Lee is skilled in the latest treatment options, including Invisalign, Damon braces and adjunct technologies such as AcceleDent. His approach focuses on tailored plans and modern, evidence-informed techniques.

image.alt: Dr. Adam Lee

paragraphs.text: Dr. Lee and his wife Karen prioritize giving back, supporting education, arts, music and local sports programs. Their community contributions are an important part of the practice’s outreach.

image.alt: Dr. Adam Lee
Dr. Ryan Morris

paragraphs.text: Dr. Ryan Morris brings a strong clinical and research background to the practice, with published work in peer-reviewed orthodontic journals and experience running a practice prior to joining Red Rock Orthodontics.
He is a diplomat of the American Board of Orthodontics and an active member of professional organizations dedicated to advancing orthodontic care.

image.alt: Dr. Ryan Morris

paragraphs.text: Dr. Morris earned a Bachelor of Science from Brigham Young University–Idaho, completed his Doctor of Dental Surgery at Creighton University, and received his Certificate of Orthodontics and Master of Science in Oral Sciences from the University of Illinois at Chicago.

image.alt: Dr. Ryan Morris

paragraphs.text: Raised in Eagle, Idaho, Dr. Morris enjoys fly tying, fishing and music. He lives in Spanish Fork with his wife and three daughters and values time spent outdoors and with family.

image.alt: Dr. Ryan Morris
Red Rock Orthodontics doctors

paragraphs.text: Collectively our doctors focus on personalized treatment plans, modern technology and a friendly patient experience. Whether you need braces, clear aligners or surgical orthodontics, we tailor care to what fits you best.

image.alt: Red Rock Orthodontics doctors

paragraphs.text: Our team treats children, teens and adults and offers advanced options such as Damon braces, Spark and Invisalign clear aligners, 3D imaging and accelerated-treatment adjuncts to improve comfort and efficiency.

image.alt: Red Rock Orthodontics doctors

paragraphs.text: Our doctors are active in the community, supporting schools, arts, music and sports programs. Community outreach and education are a regular part of our practice.

image.alt: Red Rock Orthodontics doctors

og_meta.title: About Us | Red Rock Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Meet the Red Rock Orthodontics team and learn how we combine modern technology with compassionate care to create confident smiles.

image.alt: Happy family welcomed at Red Rock Orthodontics front desk

paragraphs.text: Every smile starts with a new patient exam. Your first visit lets you meet our team, receive a complete oral evaluation with any necessary X-rays, and learn which treatment options will best meet your goals.
We review your medical history, explain recommended treatments, and go over insurance and payment options so you leave with a clear, personalized plan for care.

image.alt: Parent and child checking in at a friendly orthodontic reception

paragraphs.text: We accept most major insurance plans and file claims electronically to make using your benefits simple and convenient.

We also offer flexible payment options, including PatientFi monthly plans. Apply or learn more at https://app.patientfi.com/v2/red-rock-ortho/enterprise — there is no impact to your credit score to apply or accept an offer.
Before your appointment, please complete our health history forms so we can provide safe, personalized care. Completing forms ahead of time helps your first visit run smoothly.

image.alt: Patient filling out orthodontic health history forms online
Enjoying time together as a family

seo.page_description: Start your orthodontic care with Red Rock Orthodontics. Learn what to expect at your first visit, access patient forms, and schedule a consultation.
seo.page_keywords: orthodontics, new patient, first visit, patient forms, financing, Red Rock Orthodontics

og_meta.title: Get Started | Red Rock Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Start your orthodontic care with Red Rock Orthodontics. Learn what to expect at your first visit, access patient forms, and schedule a consultation.

image.alt: Smiling patients of all ages at Lakeshore Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Braces remain a reliable, widely used treatment to straighten teeth and correct bite problems. Using brackets and wires, braces apply gentle, consistent force to move teeth into healthier, more functional positions.

image.alt: Two stylish smiling teens taking selfie with braces

paragraphs.text: Clear aligners are a discrete, removable alternative to braces. A custom series of clear trays gradually shifts teeth using 3-D imaging and planned stages, making hygiene and meals easier during treatment.

image.alt: Smiling Woman with Clear Aligner

paragraphs.text: Invisalign<sup>®</sup> uses a sequence of clear, removable trays made from advanced 3-D scans to move teeth with precision. Your treatment begins with a digital scan, a personalized plan, and a schedule of aligner changes tailored to your case.

Many adult and teen patients appreciate the near-invisible appearance and the ability to eat and clean normally. Treatment time varies by case, but many patients notice improvement within a few months.

image.alt: Close-up of Invisalign aligners being placed on teeth

paragraphs.text: We offer Ormco’s Spark aligner technology as one of our clear-aligner options. Spark aligners are engineered for clarity and comfortable fit and may be a great choice depending on your treatment goals.

image.alt: Modern dentist office interior with advanced technology

paragraphs.text: Damon braces use a self-ligating, low-friction system that can allow wires to move more freely and may reduce the number of adjustment visits. They are a modern option for patients seeking efficient, predictable tooth movement.

image.alt: Dental Checkup with Braces

paragraphs.text: Ceramic braces use tooth-colored or clear brackets to blend with your teeth. They provide the effectiveness of traditional braces with a more discreet appearance for patients who want a less noticeable option.

image.alt: Smiling Woman with Clear Aligner

paragraphs.text: Micro or mini braces are smaller brackets made from strong stainless steel, offering a less noticeable braces option while delivering the same tooth-moving forces as traditional systems.

image.alt: Young patient receiving early orthodontic intervention

paragraphs.text: For complex jaw discrepancies, we coordinate surgical and orthodontic care to restore function and balance. Orthognathic surgery is planned with specialists and followed by orthodontic 'fine-tuning' using appliances such as braces and temporary anchorage devices (TADs).

image.alt: Orthodontic patient receiving orthognathic surgical consultation
Enjoying time together as a family

image.alt: Smiling adult patient receiving orthodontic consultation in a bright, modern clinic — orthodontics, adult treatment, clear aligners, braces

paragraphs.text: Find answers to common questions about adult orthodontics, braces, aligners, scheduling, and payment at Red Rock Orthodontics.

accordion.header: Is it too late for orthodontic treatment as an adult?

paragraphs.text: No, it’s not too late. Many adults choose orthodontic treatment to correct misaligned teeth and improve their smile. Advances in orthodontic technology make treatment more comfortable and discreet than in the past.

image.alt: Smiling family and orthodontic team in clinic, welcoming adult patients for treatment

accordion.header: What types of braces and aligners do you offer?

paragraphs.text: We offer a range of options including traditional metal braces, clear ceramic braces, and Invisalign<sup>®</sup> clear aligners. Each option has benefits; we’ll recommend the best fit for your goals and lifestyle.

image.alt: Close-up of braces and clear aligner models on display in a modern orthodontic office

accordion.header: How long will I need to wear braces or aligners?

paragraphs.text: Treatment time varies by case. Many patients complete care within about 12 to 24 months. Invisalign<sup>®</sup> patients often see results in as little as 6 to 18 months depending on complexity. We’ll provide a personalized timeline at your first visit.

image.alt: Orthodontic team reviewing treatment timeline and progress with patient using digital images

accordion.header: How much will orthodontic treatment cost?

paragraphs.text: Cost depends on the treatment type and case complexity. On average, adult treatment ranges around $4,800 to $7,135, with children often slightly less. We discuss insurance, financing, and personalized estimates during your consultation; see our first visit page for more details.

image.alt: Front desk team discussing payment plans and insurance options with a patient

accordion.header: How do I floss with braces?

paragraphs.text: Flossing with braces takes a little practice. Use waxed floss, floss at least once a day, and consider a floss threader to get under the wire. Proper brushing and flossing help prevent plaque buildup during treatment.

image.alt: Patient demonstrating flossing technique with orthodontic appliances in a bright hygiene area

accordion.header: What happens at my first orthodontic visit?

paragraphs.text: At your initial appointment we evaluate your bite, take any needed X-rays or scans, discuss treatment options, and outline a recommended plan and timeline. Bring any recent dental records and your insurance information when possible. For more details, visit our first visit page.

image.alt: Orthodontist consulting with a patient during an initial exam using digital records and X-rays

accordion.header: Will I still need braces after orthognathic (jaw) surgery?

paragraphs.text: Many patients need braces before and after jaw surgery to align teeth with the new jaw position. Your orthodontist and surgeon coordinate closely to plan the timing and steps for the best functional and aesthetic outcome.

image.alt: Orthodontic and surgical team reviewing a patient's treatment plan together

accordion.header: How do you decide which treatment is right for me?

paragraphs.text: We evaluate your bite, oral health, aesthetic goals, and lifestyle to recommend the most effective option. Factors like case complexity, desired visibility, and treatment timeline help determine whether braces, clear ceramic, or Invisalign<sup>®</sup> is best.

image.alt: Digital treatment planning on a monitor showing options for braces and aligners

accordion.header: What payment and insurance options are available?

paragraphs.text: We offer flexible monthly payment plans and accept most major dental insurance carriers. Our team will walk you through coverage, estimate your out-of-pocket cost, and explain financing options.

image.alt: Friendly front desk staff helping a patient with insurance and payment questions

accordion.header: How can I schedule an appointment and what should I bring?

paragraphs.text: Scheduling is easy — book online at https://redrockorthodontics.com/locations/ or call your nearest office. Bring a photo ID, your dental insurance information, and any recent dental records if available.

image.alt: Patient calling to schedule an orthodontic appointment at a bright reception desk
Enjoying time together as a family
